page.title: 18Shouldham-The School.1
page.content: {Facts about our school.} The school was built in 1866 with money raised by the vicar,Rev.William Maxey Allen.The building is of local brick and has a slate roof.The total cost was Â£587-5-11d.Later the building was extended by Sir Thomas Hare and a teacher's house,now known as School House,was purchased in 1897. In 1985 the School has two classes. The Infant Class has 22 children,Miss Foster is their teacher,and Mr. Swift has 16 in the Junior class. The children start school during the academic year they will be five,on a part-time basis,and leave when they are 11.Most go on to Downham Market High School,but some have transferred to Wisbech Grammar School and one has gone to Gresham's School at Holt.
